title: How to Rehydrate Dried Mushrooms

steps.headline: Use the hot water method.
Use the cold water method.
Consider using the soaking water as mushroom stock.

text:
Use the hot water method. This is the fastest method but it has the drawback of not permitting as much of the fragrance to be released. Place the dried mushrooms in a bowl. {"smallUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/0/06/Rehydrate-Dried-Mushrooms-Step-1Bullet1.jpg/v4-459px-Rehydrate-Dried-Mushrooms-Step-1Bullet1.jpg","bigUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/0/06/Rehydrate-Dried-Mushrooms-Step-1Bullet1.jpg/v4-759px-Rehydrate-Dried-Mushrooms-Step-1Bullet1.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":306,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":506.31868131868134,"licensing":"

License: Creative Commons


"} Cover with boiling water. {"smallUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/0/0b/Rehydrate-Dried-Mushrooms-Step-1Bullet2.jpg/v4-459px-Rehydrate-Dried-Mushrooms-Step-1Bullet2.jpg","bigUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/0/0b/Rehydrate-Dried-Mushrooms-Step-1Bullet2.jpg/v4-759px-Rehydrate-Dried-Mushrooms-Step-1Bullet2.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":306,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":506.31868131868134,"licensing":"

License: Creative Commons


"} Leave for 30 minutes. {"smallUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/b/b7/Rehydrate-Dried-Mushrooms-Step-1Bullet3.jpg/v4-459px-Rehydrate-Dried-Mushrooms-Step-1Bullet3.jpg","bigUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/b/b7/Rehydrate-Dried-Mushrooms-Step-1Bullet3.jpg/v4-759px-Rehydrate-Dried-Mushrooms-Step-1Bullet3.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":306,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":506.31868131868134,"licensing":"

License: Creative Commons


"} Use as required. {"smallUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/f/fd/Rehydrate-Dried-Mushrooms-Step-1Bullet4.jpg/v4-459px-Rehydrate-Dried-Mushrooms-Step-1Bullet4.jpg","bigUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/f/fd/Rehydrate-Dried-Mushrooms-Step-1Bullet4.jpg/v4-759px-Rehydrate-Dried-Mushrooms-Step-1Bullet4.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":306,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":506.31868131868134,"licensing":"

License: Creative Commons


"} Use the cold water method. This slower method has the benefit of preserving the fragrance of the mushrooms. Place the dried mushrooms in a bowl. {"smallUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/9/95/Rehydrate-Dried-Mushrooms-Step-2Bullet1.jpg/v4-459px-Rehydrate-Dried-Mushrooms-Step-2Bullet1.jpg","bigUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/9/95/Rehydrate-Dried-Mushrooms-Step-2Bullet1.jpg/v4-759px-Rehydrate-Dried-Mushrooms-Step-2Bullet1.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":306,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":506.31868131868134,"licensing":"

License: Creative Commons


"} Cover with cold water. {"smallUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/f/f0/Rehydrate-Dried-Mushrooms-Step-2Bullet2.jpg/v4-459px-Rehydrate-Dried-Mushrooms-Step-2Bullet2.jpg","bigUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/f/f0/Rehydrate-Dried-Mushrooms-Step-2Bullet2.jpg/v4-759px-Rehydrate-Dried-Mushrooms-Step-2Bullet2.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":306,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":506.31868131868134,"licensing":"

License: Creative Commons


"} Leave for at least 2 hours. {"smallUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/4/42/Rehydrate-Dried-Mushrooms-Step-2Bullet3.jpg/v4-459px-Rehydrate-Dried-Mushrooms-Step-2Bullet3.jpg","bigUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/4/42/Rehydrate-Dried-Mushrooms-Step-2Bullet3.jpg/v4-759px-Rehydrate-Dried-Mushrooms-Step-2Bullet3.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":306,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":506.31868131868134,"licensing":"

License: Creative Commons


"} Use as needed. Cut off any touch thick stems and just use the caps. {"smallUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/5/57/Rehydrate-Dried-Mushrooms-Step-2Bullet4.jpg/v4-459px-Rehydrate-Dried-Mushrooms-Step-2Bullet4.jpg","bigUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/5/57/Rehydrate-Dried-Mushrooms-Step-2Bullet4.jpg/v4-759px-Rehydrate-Dried-Mushrooms-Step-2Bullet4.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":306,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":506.31868131868134,"licensing":"

License: Creative Commons


"} Consider using the soaking water as mushroom stock.
